intro: Aceras anthropophorum lusus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in shaded, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
